meanings.definition: A rounded or elongated object or shape.
meanings.sent1: The ball was a perfect ovel, smooth and round.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the colorful ovel and placed it on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The ovel rolled down the hill, bouncing happily.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like two bright ovels in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully sketched the intricate details of the ovel.

meanings.definition: To move in a circular or elliptical path.
meanings.sent1: The planets ovel around the sun in their orbits.
meanings.sent2: He watched the toy train ovel around the track.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's graceful movements made her seem to ovel on stage.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to ovel in a never-ending loop.
meanings.sent5: The thoughts in his mind oveled endlessly, never settling.

meanings.definition: To make a rounded or elongated shape.
meanings.sent1: She carefully oveled the clay into a smooth sphere.
meanings.sent2: The baker oveled the dough before placing it in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to ovel the playdough into a perfect ball.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's hands expertly oveled the marble into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The potter gently oveled the vase on the spinning wheel.
